intro: Tricalysia vadensis, commonly known as the African wild bean, is a tropical shrub native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant has trifoliate leaves with three oval-shaped leaflets, and its flowers are typically small and clustered. Tricalysia vadensis is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects and animals.
